comments: All a(n), except a(2) = 5, are of the form (2^p + 1)/3 - the Wagstaff primes A000979[n] = {3,11,43,683,2731,43691,174763,...}.Indices of prime Jacobsthal numbers are listed in A107036[n] = {3,4,5,7,11,13,17,19,23,31,43,61,...}.For n>1 A107036[n] = A000978[n] Numbers n such that (2^n + 1)/3 is prime. - _Alexander Adamchuk_, Oct 10 2006
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..23
mathematica: Select[Table[(2^n + (-1)^(n - 1))/3, {n, 200}], PrimeQ] (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Mar 29 2011*)
author: Judson D. Neer (judson(AT)poboxes.com)
